page.title: 16Royal Residence at Clarendon
page.content: The foundation of Clarendon Palace is as obscure in the past as it is obscure to the general public now. It was built before the Norman Conquest. It has had pugilist connections all its history. Today all that remains of the once grand regal palace, on King Manor Hill, is well hidden within the forest. However with permission one may still climb up the steep hill and follow the barely discernable path, round a corner and then suddenly to meet a fallen wall. Looking round the remains today is quite awesome as part of large banqueting halls struggle to find identity with the weeds and trees. The magnificence is still seen when travellers come across the preserved stairway, which may have been a grand entrance.{The wall arch {remaining holds a carved masonry stone {illustrating some of its history.
